questions.text: When was the Pakistan Resolution (Lahore Resolution) passed?
questions.explanation: The Lahore Resolution was passed on March 23, 1940, at the annual session of the All-India Muslim League.

questions.text: Who was the first Prime Minister of Pakistan?
questions.explanation: Liaquat Ali Khan served as the first Prime Minister of Pakistan from 1947 until his assassination in 1951.

questions.text: The Two-Nation Theory was first articulated by:
questions.explanation: The Two-Nation Theory was first articulated by Sir Syed Ahmed Khan in the 19th century.

questions.text: Allama Iqbal delivered his famous Allahabad Address in:
questions.explanation: Allama Iqbal delivered his famous Allahabad Address on December 29, 1930, proposing a separate Muslim state.

questions.text: The All India Muslim League was founded in which city?
questions.explanation: The All India Muslim League was founded on December 30, 1906, in Dhaka (now Bangladesh).

questions.text: The Quit India Movement was launched in:
questions.explanation: The Quit India Movement was launched by the Indian National Congress on August 8, 1942.

questions.text: Who was the last Viceroy of British India?
questions.explanation: Lord Mountbatten was the last Viceroy of British India and oversaw the partition.

questions.text: The Lucknow Pact between Congress and Muslim League was signed in:
questions.explanation: The Lucknow Pact was signed in December 1916, establishing Hindu-Muslim political cooperation.

questions.text: Who presided over the Lahore session of Muslim League in 1940?
questions.explanation: Quaid-e-Azam Muhammad Ali Jinnah presided over the historic Lahore session where the Pakistan Resolution was passed.

questions.text: The Cabinet Mission came to India in:
questions.explanation: The Cabinet Mission arrived in India in March 1946 to discuss the transfer of power.
